website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a structured upright bath support for a smaller baby, this is a solid choice. However, babies might outgrow it sooner than other supports.
pros: Raised backrest allows even smaller babies to sit up and take in the sights while bathing
Soft mesh is comfortable and allows soapy water to drain
Dries quickly and easy to store between use
Some parents find it useful as an everyday seating solution for little ones
cons: Once they become more active, little ones could roll out or tip forward

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough
customer_reviews.text: Baby is 3 months and we’ve used it about that long. We don’t have a bathtub but a very large sink and it fits well, however I have to add a TON of water to get the basin filled enough to be high enough to cover baby’s body. For my purposes it might have been more water wise to buy a standard sling type baby bath. If you plan on filling a whole tub anyway this might be nice until baby is sitting up on their own. Also, baby would startle the first month or so because he didn’t feel super secure, so he would throw his arms out like he was falling. Washcloth on his chest helped with that.
customer_reviews.author: MillertimeUSNA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. My baby hated the bath until we got ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. My baby hated the bath until we got this seat. Now she loves it. We bought it when she was 3 weeks old and at 10 weeks she still loves it. Kicks and plays the whole bath.
customer_reviews.author: bookreader

customer_reviews.title: Love! Comes in handy so often, even at the beach!

customer_reviews.title: Safety!
customer_reviews.text: At about 2.5 months, my daughter was able to pop herself out of this. Leaned back, bucked her hips up, hit the centerpiece, went to the side. Even with me hovering, this happened quickly. DANGEROUS. Screaming baby and bruising. There wasn’t much water in the tub at all either. The item is very narrow-maybe if it were wider? We’ve tried it again at 3 months...my daughter leans forward and props her elbows on the side to watch her feet splash...again, obvious problems here. Was good until 2.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Honestly...

customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. But the most your going to get out of it is 6 months and more than likely it will be closer to 4/5 months. Obviously it works for some people even though I don't see how, but as for me I will be giving it away and continuing to use his previous tub.

customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 4-month-old grandson to use on his first visit with us. My daughter and son-in-law absolutely loved it!! Not practical for chunky babies, my son kept sliding down. Pros: I mean it will do the job if need be. Easy to store. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Briauna

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves this bath!
customer_reviews.text: I was using a regular basic tub with sling insert and once she outgrew the sling she hated bathtime and she used to love it. The seat just wasn’t comfortable for her anymore as she got bigger. I searched for a better way to give her a bath. Got this and she loves bathtime again! All smiles the whole time. So happy. The only thing is she is so wild in this time kicking her legs everywhere I have to keep a hand lightly on her or she tends to throw her butt out of it and then sinks into the water. But not the tubs fault... moreso my incredibly wild baby!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great baby bath
customer_reviews.text: The best baby bath ever. I did have a blooming bath with my first child which I loved but I didnt like that it held an order and was super hard to dry. You will have to keep splashing (splashing sounds bad but you know what I mean) water on their legs and belly so they dont get cold. Other than that it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shianne Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby baths!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is very long for her age and quickly outgrew her baby bath, plus I did not like how she would always slip down. This works great in the bathtub! I started using it when she was about 3 months old, but for my next baby I will use it sooner. It helps support the baby great and makes giving baths easy. My daughter is always very happy in it. It also have a loop at the end and so I just easily hang it up on a suction hook in the shower to dry out.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: I loooove this, I’m obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: So I had a Skiphop bathtub from my first kid. I had been using it and now that my baby was more mobile it didn’t work at all for me. I instantly fell in love with this! Is ridiculously comfortable, in fact my almost 5 months old baby seemed happy! I could bathe him super fast and comfortably. I wish I had this when he was a newborn!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karla M

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tub on a whim. The bath we were given was too big for a newborn. I ordered this tub when my daughter was just under two months old. She’s now an adorable chuncky lil almost 7 month old and still fits! We even brought it to the beach a few months ago and put a blanket over and our daughter seemed very comfy and relaxed. I know this because she was asleep the whole time lol
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R Hall

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Baby Bath
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th baby bath I have used over the course of 10 years and 5 babies. This baby bath is by far my favorite. It supports the baby's head and neck. The soft plastic back makes it comfortable while allowing the bath to air out and prevent mold. The "icing on the cake" is the fact that I can hang up the bath on the side of my shower to keep in out of the way in my small bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Neff Fam

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase

customer_reviews.title: Best tub!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many different tubes and my little guy just didnt seem like he was getting the support he needed... he would either float or his head would drop in the water.. we tried the flower a baby tub all kinds of things and then my friend told me about this one and it is the best thing ever! It holds him great his head doesn't wobble back and forth and it's super light weight and easy cleaning and drying!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Powers

customer_reviews.title: Happy baby, happy mom
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy something my son could sit on for bathing, I started with the flower, but my sink was way to big for it. Out of curiosity I put him in the chair fully clothed and he happily sat there for an hour talking and giggling. Next we tried a bath and he got to enjoy the water kicking his feet wiggling. I'm very happy with this purchase, easy clean, easier dry, and the baby is happy. It's all I could ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Rhemarhart

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Love that baby isn't sitting in dirty water while I bath her. I can also put this in the bath and bathe both my toddler and baby at the same time which is nice. Hook makes hanging it to dry in the shower convenient.
customer_reviews.author: SepticMinivan

They work well together but I don’t think it will be good once she is sitting up by herself...maybe for the first 6 months it’s awesome, though.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my twins!
customer_reviews.text: Ok seriously if you are using anything but this.... stop what you are doing and BUY THIS NOW. I also love how easy they are to stack together and store! And I don’t even have to dry them off or anything. Just leave them in the bottom of the tub after bath time to drip dry. I soooo recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Looks really handy.
customer_reviews.text: Baby not here yet...so haven't actually used it. But...much more convenient size than those we have had in the past. Smooth to touch and I like the no-slip finish on it. And that it is self-draining. So handy that we can hang it up out of the way. Someone else pointed out that it is handy to keep in the bathroom to set the baby down when Momma has to 'go'. Great idea!
customer_reviews.author: a researcher in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be worth it

customer_reviews.text: So this tub made the most sense to me ever... then I had my baby. Not a bad product but I found out it wasn’t for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to do
customer_reviews.text: My son used to scream bloody murder in his old bath tub, i thought he just hated baths but once we switched to this tub he’s so much more calm! Oh and I like how I can just set it down wherever and the water just drips off. It’s also not bulky at all compared to other tubs.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Ayala

customer_reviews.title: easy to rinse
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a little late - around 6 months - but it was helpful for transitioning to sitting in the tub. The design allows water to flow all around the baby, easy to rinse. Sits well in the big tub. Obviously, parental attention is still required - when my baby arched her back she could get her bottom over the bump on the end. Once she started sitting up, it kept her from sliding around - she could sit up with her bottom at the bottom. Also highly recommend the Keter Bath Seatfor the sitting up stage. (We used it with our first who crawled long before she sat - her sister didn't really need it.)
customer_reviews.author: Y. Chatz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for baths
customer_reviews.text: Love this for baths. We've been using this since the first immersion bath to today and our little one is 10 months. customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Angelcare Bath! We decided to purchase it after being gifted a different brand and make that had Styrofoam around the edging. It became very mildew smelling. customer_reviews.author: MegWes

customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Multi-use seat

customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Only suggestion is they make more gender neutral colors..
customer_reviews.text: Only suggestion for improvement would be they make more gender friendly colors of this seat, like yellow, light green ect. It sits at just the right angle so she isn't submerged in too much water either. I think this is the first time bath time hasn't been petrified screaming.. Was as it should be with warm soothing water & baby's comfortable :-)
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Overall solid product, some downfalls

It makes it not comfortable for baby if never really fully in warm water. Still think it's a solid product, though: inexpensive, easy-to-clean, and anti-slip for baby. Makes it a lot less messy and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great option but kiddo does not like this
customer_reviews.text: We actually did not use this bath. There is absolutely nothing wrong with it but our kiddo hates this thing. Babies are slippery and I felt much more comfortable while my spouse was there helping me. If your little doesn’t mind being on their back then this could work for you. I think it’s worth it to try all options for your kids. See what works for you.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.author: AusDarHam

customer_reviews.author: B. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love this. We cam bathe baby with her sister ...

And it cleans very easily after the baby decides to poop on it while getting a bath.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy
